meanings.definition: The state or quality of being musty or stale.
meanings.sent1: The fustinesses of the old books filled the room with a dusty smell.
meanings.sent2: The basement's fustinesses made it clear that it had not been cleaned in years.
meanings.sent3: Despite the fustinesses of the attic, it held hidden treasures waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: The fustinesses of the antique shop transported visitors back in time.
meanings.sent5: The fustinesses of the abandoned house gave it a mysterious aura.

meanings.definition: A feeling of being old-fashioned or outdated.
meanings.sent1: Her style had a touch of fustinesses that reminded people of the past.
meanings.sent2: The fustinesses of the vintage clothing store attracted those who loved retro fashion.
meanings.sent3: Despite the fustinesses of the old record player, it still played music beautifully.
meanings.sent4: The fustinesses of the classic car made it a timeless beauty on the road.
meanings.sent5: The fustinesses of the museum's artifacts brought history to life for visitors.
